intro: Picris crepoides, commonly known as common sickleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in meadows. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are yellow and appear in late summer. Picris crepoides is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
